"One of the very best writers now working the beat." ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½Wall Street Journal

"If there is one crime writer currently capable of matching the legacies of

Francisco Chronicle

----

The New York Times bestselling author and master of the modern mystery 
returns with a fierce and poignant new novel featuring his acclaimed 
killer-for-hire, Keller. John Keller is everyone&#039;s favorite hit man. He&#039;s cool. 
Reliable. A real pro: the hit man&#039;s hit man. The inconvenient wife, the 
business partner, the retiree with a substantial legacy. He&#039;s taken care of 
them all, quietly and efficiently.

Keller&#039;s got a code of honor, though he&#039;d never call it that. And he keeps the 
job strictly business. But while Keller might be a pragmatic and crack assassin, 
he&#039;s also prone to doubts and loneliness just like everybody else. And though 
he&#039;s got Dot, his wisecracking contact and sometimes confidante, these days, 
it doesn&#039;t seem to be enough.

Keller&#039;s been at this business a long while. Just maybe it&#039;s time to pack it in. 
Only problem is, retirement takes money. And to get money, he&#039;s got to go to 
work...

Hit Parade, the third novel featuring the fascinating Keller, displays the 
hallmarks that distinguish Lawrence Block&#039;s award-winning fiction: the 
intelligence, the clever plotting, the humor, the tricky twist and ironic turns, 
the darkness and emotional complexityÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½and, above all else, the humanity.

----

Lawrence Block is one of the most widely recognized names in the mystery 
genre. He has been named a Grand Master of the Mystery Writers of America 
and is a four-time winner of the prestigious Edgar and Shamus awards, as 
well as a recipient of prizes in France, Germany, and Japan. He received the 
Diamond Dagger from the British Crime Writer&#039;s Association, only the third 
American (after Sara Paretsky and Ed McBain) to be given this award. He is a 
prolific author, having written more than fifty books and numerous short 
stories, and is a devoted New Yorker who spends much of his time traveling.

www.lawrenceblock.com
